monster.name: Brock the Brave

trait.name: Aura of Protection
trait.text: Whenever Brock or a friendly creature within 10 feet of him must make a saving throw, they gain +4 to the saving throw.

trait.name: Divine Sense (5/day)
trait.text: Brock can use an action to know the location of any celestial, fiend, or undead within 60 feet of him that is not behind total cover.

trait.name: Divine Smite
trait.text: When Brock hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, he can expend on spell slot to deal radiant damage. 1d8 for a 1st-level slot and 2d8 for a 2nd-level slot. The damage increases by 1d8 if the target is an undead or a fiend.

trait.name: Lay on Hands
trait.text: Brock has a pool of healing power. He can use that pool to restore 30 hit points or less to a creature he touches. He can also use 5 hit points to cure one disease or neutralize one poison.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Brock is a 6th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He can cast the following spells:
1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, searing smite, shield of faith, thunderous smite
2nd level (2 slots): find steed, magic weapon

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.spells: cure wounds, searing smite, shield of faith, thunderous smite, find steed, magic weapon
monster.slots:
4,2</slots The leader of the seven adventurers is an eager paladin. Brock is bold and courageous but still rather young. He began adventuring when he was a teenager. Brock obeys the laws of the kingdom and is the epitome of a loyal companion.
Inquisitive Warrior. His greatest quality is his endless enthusiasm and curiosity. Brock wants to explore the world and learn about places he’s never seen before. He prefers to lead from the front and does not back down from a challenge.
Humble Beginnings. The young man grew up on a farm, far away from the bustling city of Wyld. His family is closeknit and they’re hoping he’ll return soon. His simple upbringing helps to keep him grounded. He doesn’t trust merchants and won’t believe a word they say.
Chivalry is Still Alive. Brock will do anything to protect a damsel in distress. He is a romantic at heart and believes in true love.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Dungeon p. 8 (ThirdParty) any
